problem_text:
Let φ be an automorphism of prime order p of a nilpotent (periodic) group G such that CG(φ) is a group of finite sectional rank r. Does G possess a normal subgroup N which is nilpotent of class bounded by a function of p only and is such that G/N is a group of finite sectional rank bounded in terms of r and p? This was proved for p = 2 in (P. Shumyatsky, Arch. Math., 71 (1998), 425–432).
E. I. Khukhro
answer: Yes, it does (E. I. Khukhro, J. London Math. Soc., 77 (2008), 130–148).
